it.cnr.isti.labse.glimpse.api.consumer
Interface GlimpseConsumer

All Superinterfaces:
javax.jms.MessageListener
All Known Implementing Classes:
GlimpseAbstractConsumer, MyGlimpseConsumer
public interface GlimpseConsumer
extends javax.jms.MessageListener

Implementing this interface to create a communication with the monitoring Enabler.

It is possible to use a generic implementation of the consumer using or extending the class GlimpseAbstractConsumer However, implementing this interface the behaviour of the consumer must respect the following actions:

Send a TextMessage that contains the Xml generated following the ComplexEventRequest schema

The message must be sent on the jms://serviceTopic channel.
The consumer must listen for the response of the monitoring infrastructure that will send a jms textMessage containing the response channel where to connect to listen for the evaluation results.

To aid on the creation of the XML, you can use the class ComplexEventRuleActionListDocument.
Possible XML actions are: Insert Delete Start Stop Restart.

When a well structured message (see exampleRule.xml) is received from the monitoring infrastructure
the monitoring will provide a responseMessage (TextMessage) containing the name
************************************************************************
**************An usage example is available here GlimpseAbstractConsumer**************
************************************************************************

Version:
0.4
Author:
Antonello Calabrò

Method Summary
 javax.jms.TextMessage getMonitorStatusMessage(javax.jms.TopicSession publishSession, boolean debug)

          Send a ActionList of rules to the monitoring infrastructure requesting an evaluation.
If the request is accepted, the monitoring will answer with a responseChannel where to connect
The actionList parameter is a list of action to provide to the Monitoring
To create it, you can use ComplexEventRuleActionListDocument class.

getMonitorStatusMessage

javax.jms.TextMessage getMonitorStatusMessage(javax.jms.TopicSession publishSession,
                                              boolean debug)
Parameters:
publishSession - the TopicSession where to send the message
debug - debug value
Returns:
a TextMessage that can be sent to the monitoring infrastructure
to obtain the Status of the monitoring enabler
that is defined using the enum Status

sendActionListMessage

void sendActionListMessage(javax.jms.TopicConnection connection,
                           javax.naming.InitialContext initContext,
                           java.lang.String serviceChannel,
                           it.cnr.isti.labse.glimpse.xml.complexEventRule.ComplexEventRuleActionListDocument actionList,
                           boolean debug)
                           throws javax.jms.JMSException,
                                  javax.naming.NamingException
Send a ActionList of rules to the monitoring infrastructure requesting an evaluation.
If the request is accepted, the monitoring will answer with a responseChannel where to connect
The actionList parameter is a list of action to provide to the Monitoring
To create it, you can use ComplexEventRuleActionListDocument class.

initContext -
serviceChannel -
actionList -
debug - debug value

javax.jms.JMSException
javax.naming.NamingException
